message_1: Suppose that P and Q are propositions such that P is true and Q is false. Find the truth value of the proposition ~(P or Q).
message_2:
Given that P is true and Q is false, we can evaluate the proposition (P or Q) as follows:

P or Q = True or False = True

Now, we need to find the truth value of the negation of this proposition, which is ~(P or Q):

~(P or Q) = ~True = False

So, the truth value of the proposition ~(P or Q) is False.
